    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Creating objectives</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            How to create an objective ? What are the settings available ?
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4405384/square_128/DSC09723_%281%29-1603897479.jpg?1603897479" alt="Kevin Legros avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Kevin Legros</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">It is possible to <b>assign Objectives to Learners</b>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">First the objectives have to be created, which can only be done by <b>Administrators / Partner administrators</b>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">‚ö†Ô∏è The Objectives created by Internal Administrators are transversal to all Platforms, in the sense that they can be assigned to Users of different Platforms by Internal Administrators. On the other hand, a Partner Administrator can only have access to the Objectives created by an Administrator of his own Partner Platform and can only register Users of his own Partner Platform.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">To access the objectives, click on the <b>Side Menu</b> &gt; <b>Objectives </b>&gt; <b>Create</b></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234960914/67b2368a7848a057afd522a6/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+16.22.25.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=b58cff1e571714060e802cec1fcc8826bab51b4f4a7c346ddc9905b9feb7c9cf" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234960914/67b2368a7848a057afd522a6/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+16.22.25.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=b58cff1e571714060e802cec1fcc8826bab51b4f4a7c346ddc9905b9feb7c9cf"></a></div><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="hidden-goal" data-post-processed="true">Hidden goal</h2><p class="no-margin">It will be necessary to specify for each Objective created whether it is a hidden Objective or not. If it is not hidden, it means that Learners registered for this Objective will not know and will not see the Objective in question displayed on their Dashboard.</p><h2 id="success-points" data-post-processed="true"><br><br>Success Points</h2><p class="no-margin">The "Success point" field only appears if the "Levels" functionality has been activated in the Settings.</p><p class="no-margin">This field allows you to assign success points to each objective in order to earn them for your learners and thus make them progress in level.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/257093024/d91e65b5e111f21f3d6ae819/image.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=be2646c48cb3890489501f14c43709c864d825f5714e87c7b91806077b5a9c4f" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/257093024/d91e65b5e111f21f3d6ae819/image.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=be2646c48cb3890489501f14c43709c864d825f5714e87c7b91806077b5a9c4f"></a></div><p class="no-margin">For more information see <a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/4549492">Activate objectives for learners</a>.<br></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="action" data-post-processed="true">Action</h2><p class="no-margin">It is necessary to specify the action that the Learner must succeed in doing in order to achieve his Objective. The different choices are available in the drop-down list below.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235214304/f0d0a3b0aca51930f183c8a0/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.09.19.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=113097a64891dc2aee21d0587ee81be62e8e7f7c25d35f79ad0183302576b8e9" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235214304/f0d0a3b0aca51930f183c8a0/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.09.19.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=113097a64891dc2aee21d0587ee81be62e8e7f7c25d35f79ad0183302576b8e9"></a></div><p class="no-margin">The possible types of Objectives are:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Complete a course or several courses</b>, the list of which will be specified, and this within a period of time to be defined (Start date and End date to be entered (to add to the training objective, all you have to do is click on the small + in front of 'LIST OF PERIMETERS', which allows you to enter additional training to be completed)</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Complete one or more objectives</b>, the list of which will be specified, and this within a period of time to be defined (Start date and End date to be entered) (in the same way, just click on the little + in front of 'LIST PERIMETERS ', to enter an additional objective to be completed)</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Spend time (pedagogical duration) </b>on one or more training courses / training categories / training path, and this within a period of time to be defined (Start date and End date to be entered - optional)</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235215479/ba3d3dfe39622745c418db62/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.12.15.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=c53669ea4142611c3c211259f009bd54011676401531be7f74ffabc7cae38793" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235215479/ba3d3dfe39622745c418db62/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.12.15.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=c53669ea4142611c3c211259f009bd54011676401531be7f74ffabc7cae38793"></a></div><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Spend time (actual duration)</b> on one or more training courses / training categories / training path, and this within a period of time to be defined (Start date and End date to be entered - optional)</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">‚ö†Ô∏è Once the <b>actions</b> have been defined when creating the goal, <b>you will not be able to come and modify them later.</b></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Last updated on 11/05/2020.</p></article>
    </div>
  </div>

</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">To view all objectives, click on the <b>Side Menu </b>&gt; <b>Objectives</b> &gt; <b>View</b></p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235237431/a03ea7685fedeaa496310228/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+11.18.51.png?expires=1620407306&amp;signature=d9e3fba06870c9799aa5f1c3866d3b5d2fd3d7a0ce565b8b38072e054189ce3f" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235237431/a03ea7685fedeaa496310228/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+11.18.51.png?expires=1620407306&amp;signature=d9e3fba06870c9799aa5f1c3866d3b5d2fd3d7a0ce565b8b38072e054189ce3f"></a></div><p class="no-margin">From this screen, it is possible to sort the objectives using the sorting tool on the right of the screen.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">For each of the Objectives already created, it is possible to:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Change </b>the Objective</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Manage the Objective</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">Managing the objective consists essentially of <b>registering Users or Groups of Users for the desired Objective</b></p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">Access more options by clicking on "More options" (the 3 vertical dots)</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">There are 3 possible actions:</p><p class="no-margin">&gt; <b>Manage visibility</b></p><p class="no-margin">&gt;<b> Delete</b> the objective</p><p class="no-margin">&gt; <b>Duplicate</b> the objective</p></article>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div class="paper paper__large">
  <div class="content content__narrow">
    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Register Users for an Objective</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 08/11/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4405384/square_128/DSC09723_%281%29-1603897479.jpg?1603897479" alt="Kevin Legros avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Kevin Legros</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">Acces : <b>Side Menu </b>&gt; <b>Objectives</b> &gt; <b>View</b></p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235218668/f3fc7c0e3843cdd78c33a470/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.21.47.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=b0c8ad433ef6bff850d62df034a825697e3f3d39093165d7f75f46e17ec27500" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235218668/f3fc7c0e3843cdd78c33a470/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.21.47.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=b0c8ad433ef6bff850d62df034a825697e3f3d39093165d7f75f46e17ec27500"></a></div><p class="no-margin">From the <b>Objective Consultation Page</b>, by clicking on ‚öôÔ∏è on the line corresponding to the desired Objective, one arrives on the Objective Management page.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235219727/7ae114e1b7c50d12071ab128/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.25.23.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=33fd7058c236f21192b1d461c617b317a50f24e54ab1df89fc6973280150771d" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235219727/7ae114e1b7c50d12071ab128/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.25.23.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=33fd7058c236f21192b1d461c617b317a50f24e54ab1df89fc6973280150771d"></a></div><p class="no-margin">The screen for managing an objective looks like this:</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235220464/b84e9c66ae49c9435160b59a/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.29.20.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=613f63c71cf919a9f5320fd61145a3eb4259703c4169bd9c149ee349a322ced5" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235220464/b84e9c66ae49c9435160b59a/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.29.20.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=613f63c71cf919a9f5320fd61145a3eb4259703c4169bd9c149ee349a322ced5"></a></div><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="register-a-learner-for-an-objective" data-post-processed="true">Register a learner for an objective</h2><p class="no-margin">By clicking on the <b>Registered Users</b> or<b> Linked Groups</b> button, the list of Users already registered for this Objective and the list of Groups which have already been linked to this Objective are displayed respectively.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">On the right of the screen, it is possible to sort on the Users registered with the Objective/ groups linked to the Objective based on the following criteria:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">The percentage of progress achieved by Users / Groups.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Groups that you want to take into account</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">By clicking on <b>Register Users to Objective</b>, you can select the users that you want to register for the desired Objective :</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235221113/2cae673709a11290bbc542e4/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.31.35.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=049557f71a8ca983e931bae89d86dd117e95a83048c010212c38621d91d597c2" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235221113/2cae673709a11290bbc542e4/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.31.35.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=049557f71a8ca983e931bae89d86dd117e95a83048c010212c38621d91d597c2"></a></div><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235588073/0ce96f2d8379fe82cb58321d/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-12+%C3%A0+09.53.37.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=121a8d8fe8d64920d1910d44bf7f758b28ff711ceae4a78b2cce0b2e56473682" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235588073/0ce96f2d8379fe82cb58321d/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-12+%C3%A0+09.53.37.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=121a8d8fe8d64920d1910d44bf7f758b28ff711ceae4a78b2cce0b2e56473682"></a></div><p class="no-margin">Users and / or Groups are displayed on the left side of the screen (depending on the boxes that have been checked). You can scroll to view all the users / groups that can be registered. To register a User or a group, simply click on the corresponding ‚ûï and the selected user / group is then transferred to the right side.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235588428/ad97949b5efcd3c34ec4dda8/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-12+%C3%A0+09.56.33.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=d53f7b6ed27d9d5166ac06c2453aa3b30b04f3e499206fc5956ad12d3f5929ec" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235588428/ad97949b5efcd3c34ec4dda8/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-12+%C3%A0+09.56.33.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=d53f7b6ed27d9d5166ac06c2453aa3b30b04f3e499206fc5956ad12d3f5929ec"></a></div><p class="no-margin">Once the selection has been made and all the users / groups that you want to register are placed in the right area, you just have to click on the <b>Register</b> button (#) to effectively register all these users for the Objective in question. The number of Users concerned is indicated in parentheses in the Button.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">As soon as you click on the <b>Register</b> button (#), you will go back to the<b> Objective Management</b> page where you can note that your users have successfully registered for the objective.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235228310/744ab46a1127f2fa6f1f15cf/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.56.09.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=2d839941820d09999147779cadd96faa4625e71ee85ff80c687ed8d1be286e97" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235228310/744ab46a1127f2fa6f1f15cf/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.56.09.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=2d839941820d09999147779cadd96faa4625e71ee85ff80c687ed8d1be286e97"></a></div><p class="no-margin">At the top of the <b>Objective Management page</b>, you can see that the box at the top right on Statistics has been updated with the number of Users registered for the Goal in question.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235589706/aab0ddd900985abad088d461/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-12+%C3%A0+10.01.19.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=587ec0265255f6a6a2a1fdd6195215abcdebd84c4152e4c65acc5d9d9ebae707" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235589706/aab0ddd900985abad088d461/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-12+%C3%A0+10.01.19.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=587ec0265255f6a6a2a1fdd6195215abcdebd84c4152e4c65acc5d9d9ebae707"></a></div><h2 id="link-one-or-more-groups-to-an-objective" data-post-processed="true">Link one or more Groups to an Objective</h2><p class="no-margin">When you link a Group to an Objective, this means that any user who is subsequently integrated into this Group, would then automatically be assigned this Objective, without there being any need to register this user for this Objective.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">It is therefore different to register all members of a Group to an Objective (see above) and link a Group to an Objective.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">The screens that appear to link a Group to an Objective are similar in design to the screens for registering Users / Groups to an Objective.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235229403/c80c3dd39f16e96cc4bce30e/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.59.36.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=5d8a63d8b79bc25daf362c8046d4df7b8743ff634afe17c0c1677c51603eac2b" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235229403/c80c3dd39f16e96cc4bce30e/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+10.59.36.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=5d8a63d8b79bc25daf362c8046d4df7b8743ff634afe17c0c1677c51603eac2b"></a></div><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235229738/7ae6e13061df464a6aa8817d/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+11.01.00.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=c37d6da0e5aaee608084bd4f07617a01b62e7b2cca464ec90528ba2e662e340f" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/235229738/7ae6e13061df464a6aa8817d/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-11+%C3%A0+11.01.00.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=c37d6da0e5aaee608084bd4f07617a01b62e7b2cca464ec90528ba2e662e340f"></a></div><p class="no-margin"></p></article>
    </div>

    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Creating groups</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 08/10/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4405384/square_128/DSC09723_%281%29-1603897479.jpg?1603897479" alt="Kevin Legros avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Kevin Legros</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">Creating a group on Rise-Up allows you to manage easily a set of users. You can register them with a single click for trainings, training path, filter and sort your statistical reports or even allow them to communicate with each other from the community.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">To create a group, you will have to go to the <b>Side Menu</b> &gt; <b>Groups</b> &gt;<b> Create</b></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Only <b><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3973902">Administrators</a></b> and partner administrators can create or modify user groups.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234851368/8855d664001a7008234691e6/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.07.50.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=d1fc29f1e533c8346f28cbd4843d297be152f2c8921b810c5adac3e0c23fdd2c" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234851368/8855d664001a7008234691e6/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.07.50.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=d1fc29f1e533c8346f28cbd4843d297be152f2c8921b810c5adac3e0c23fdd2c"></a></div><p class="no-margin">You must first of all <b>Create a group</b>, by entering the title and scope and clicking on <b>Next</b>, to then access the other detailed settings.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234851670/f6615ad06305997ff5135a64/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.09.00.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=1a24d265eb4d3b8301832644b88afb7b2a2567c416da7d13807c2a786b902e4d" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234851670/f6615ad06305997ff5135a64/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.09.00.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=1a24d265eb4d3b8301832644b88afb7b2a2567c416da7d13807c2a786b902e4d"></a></div><h2 id="general-information" data-post-processed="true">General information</h2><p class="no-margin">A Group is necessarily associated with a single platform (<b>internal</b> or <b>partner</b>). The scope of the group is configured when it is created, and cannot be modified subsequently.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="configuration" data-post-processed="true">Configuration</h2><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Hidden Group</b>: Checking this box means that members of this Group will not see the name of the Group appear on their Dashboard and will not know that they are part of this group.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Create a board on the Community page</b>: Checking this box triggers the creation of a board dedicated to the Group on the Community page. The board will bear the name of the Group and will be open to all members of the Group.<br><br></p></li></ul><h2 id="smart-group" data-post-processed="true">Smart Group</h2><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234852347/769ac04b5a9314e529f10598/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.11.33.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=6c580100a8a47c28aae2a19ed3a6d8a2cd993ef2d1d0b45249cc008224cbb120" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234852347/769ac04b5a9314e529f10598/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.11.33.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=6c580100a8a47c28aae2a19ed3a6d8a2cd993ef2d1d0b45249cc008224cbb120"></a></div><p class="no-margin">It is possible to define a <b>Smart Group</b>, ie to establish r<b>ules based on certain fields of users to automatically register them in a Group</b>. The elements that can be taken into account are:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">The user's email address</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">The role of the user</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Username</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Internal ID</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Phone number</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Language</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Creation date</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Date of suspension</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Group to which the user belongs</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Custom fields defined</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">The conditions may or may not be cumulative. As soon as the <b>smart rules have been defined</b>, you can view all the users meeting the defined rules by clicking on üëÅÔ∏è&zwj;üó®Ô∏è <b>Concerned users</b>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234852658/eba283e2d9b302ae6c6ba55f/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.11.33.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=5f00697ea2a8428cd20617c390451af5f84e0277cb9931bb4fcfe7f278ed0977" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234852658/eba283e2d9b302ae6c6ba55f/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.11.33.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=5f00697ea2a8428cd20617c390451af5f84e0277cb9931bb4fcfe7f278ed0977"></a></div><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234853206/1d50c36f405350631389bd4d/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.13.37.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=ced4a961f97a4554be84d89d2d76b220c8fe900acb6622e15a8dc0ec64a4a373" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234853206/1d50c36f405350631389bd4d/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.13.37.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=ced4a961f97a4554be84d89d2d76b220c8fe900acb6622e15a8dc0ec64a4a373"></a></div><p class="no-margin"><b>Automatically delete users from group if it doesn't match the rules anymore</b> :</p><p class="no-margin">If this box is not checked, users will not be deleted from the Group automatically if they no longer correspond to the rules for belonging to the Group.<br><br></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="group-members" data-post-processed="true">Group members</h2><p class="no-margin">In this section you can define a Group Manager or several Group Managers for the Group in question. </p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234853717/fb1462ae61e67ac6173c23c2/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.16.25.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=c187d216f4df6001c319187ef65342172ac5ee3d36747e43ab90c0b658670990" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234853717/fb1462ae61e67ac6173c23c2/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-10+%C3%A0+11.16.25.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=c187d216f4df6001c319187ef65342172ac5ee3d36747e43ab90c0b658670990"></a></div><p class="no-margin">Any Group Manager, by default has the necessary rights to:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>View the results obtained by the Group</b> he manages. He has access to the results of the training courses attended: time spent on the various modules / stages, answers to quizzes, exams, etc.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Validate</b> (that is to say accept or refuse) <b>registration requests</b> from members of the Group.</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">In addition to these default rights, it is possible to allow Group Managers to directly register members of their group for training (without the members of the group having to make a request). To do this, you must check one of the following 3 boxes (see screen above):</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">Every training</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Only visible trainings</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">A list of allowed trainings</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">By checking the last of these 3 boxes, you can define the training courses that the Group Manager(s) has the right to manage.<br><br> </p><h2 id="maximum-number-of-users" data-post-processed="true">Maximum number of users</h2><p class="no-margin">This field allows you to enter the maximum number of users that can be included in the defined Group. This field can only be entered if it is not a 'Smart Group'.</p></article>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div class="paper paper__large">
  <div class="content content__narrow">
    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Consulting and viewing groups</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            How do I access the list of members of my group? How to access the list of training courses / courses to which they have registered?
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4405384/square_128/DSC09723_%281%29-1603897479.jpg?1603897479" alt="Kevin Legros avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Kevin Legros</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">To view a group you will have to go to the <b>Side Menu</b> &gt; <b>Groups </b>&gt; <b>View</b></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">If the user is a <b>Group Manager</b>, he will only be able to view the group(s) for which he is a manager.</p><p class="no-margin">As <b>Administrator</b>, you see all the platform groups (on your perimeter).</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/266106608/984e0e07cb5c48495e871b95/image.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=ccd8c80a7d242cab527fdf095e43d26bf1aa8ccee1aef931db51041dafc6f39b" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/266106608/984e0e07cb5c48495e871b95/image.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=ccd8c80a7d242cab527fdf095e43d26bf1aa8ccee1aef931db51041dafc6f39b"></a></div><p class="no-margin">From this screen, he will be able to :</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Contact all members of his Group</b> : the user will be able to write his email directly in a pop-up that appear</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Display related training</b> : this is the list of trainings to which group members are automatically registered when they are integrated into the group</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Display related paths</b> : this is the list of training paths to which group members are automatically registered when they are integrated into the group</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Display the list of group members</b></p></li></ul><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">As an <b>Administrator or Partner Administrator</b>, you will also be able to:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Modify a Group </b>‚úèÔ∏è</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Delete a Group </b></p></li></ul><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234856870/17aa76792c939cb061fcff2e/image.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=4c599a646d8b73881094ffe84584670df979c36fb7e6f0ab7276c50c0ec09c35" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/234856870/17aa76792c939cb061fcff2e/image.png?expires=1620407308&amp;signature=4c599a646d8b73881094ffe84584670df979c36fb7e6f0ab7276c50c0ec09c35"></a></div><p class="no-margin"><br></p><p class="no-margin"><i>Last updated on 11/13/2020</i></p></article>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div class="link__arrow o__ltr">Presentation of different users</div>
</div>

  <div class="paper paper__large">
  <div class="content content__narrow">
    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Presentation of different users</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            What are the different roles available on the platform? What features are available for each role?
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4004378/square_128/photo_profil-1587972480.png?1587972480" alt="Claire Philippe avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Claire Philippe</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">The roles available on the platform and described in this article are:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">Administrator</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Partner administrator</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Designer</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Animator</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Community Manager</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Group manager</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Learner</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">For a summary of the different functionalities available by role, consult the following matrix: <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GAwphNjuCjjPQsaIvIcf7OejBoBz0miGEZgACAQdTfg/edit?usp=sharing" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">Simplified table of rights according to profiles</a><br><br></p><h2 id="administrator" data-post-processed="true">Administrator</h2><p class="no-margin">The administrator is a user assigned the highest level of permissions on the Rise Up platform. Among their main assignments:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">Pre-configuring the Rise Up platform (e.g. setting the platform‚Äôs colors, activating Catalogs, forums, configuration of the training registration mode, etc.).</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Creating Partner Platforms.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Creating users, including registration of other administrators.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Creating training courses and training paths.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Registering users for training, training paths, etc.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Managing E-mails and legal documents.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Etc.</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">There can be several administrators, all with the same permissions. A minimum degree of coordination is needed between them. Administrators are the only people with the gear-wheel button  at the top right of the top banner. This is the button is used to configure the platform.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="partner-administrator" data-post-processed="true">Partner administrator</h2><p class="no-margin">If it is decided to set up one or more partners, the administrator (of the parent platform) will be able to register one or more partner administrators, whose role will be to administer their own partner platform.</p><p class="no-margin">Partner administrators cannot configure their partner platforms (only administrators can to this).</p><p class="no-margin">As far as day-to-day administration is concerned (creating users, training, registering for training, etc.), apart from a few details, a partner administrator has the same permissions as an administrator (insofar as the administrator has given ‚Äúfull control‚Äù permissions to the partner administrators when creating partner platforms) but can only exercise these permissions over the scope of the partner users associated with their platform. It is possible to delegate some administrative permissions to partner administrators (for details, refer to the ‚ÄúPartner Platforms‚Äù module/stage).<br></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="designer-" data-post-processed="true">Designer </h2><p class="no-margin">The designer designs and creates training.</p><p class="no-margin">Designers have the necessary permissions to:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Create training</b> and <b>training paths</b> (both on the main platform but also on partner platforms, where applicable),<br>Please note that, by default, training created by a designer must first be approved by an administrator (maybe a partner administrator) to become accessible and visible to learners. However, it is possible to configure the platform to allow designers to publish training they have created directly, without having to go through approval by an administrator (or partner administrator).</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Creating certificates</b> (that the designer links to the training)</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Viewing platform users</b>, but they cannot create users (exclusive prerogative of the administrator or partner administrator).</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Above all, designers can<b> register users for the training and training paths they have created </b>(or to all the trainings of the platform depending on your settings).<b> </b>They have access to the statistics of users and to do so, they have access to view all of the platform‚Äôs users.</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">Training may have several designers (co-designers), thus requiring a minimal degree of coordination between them. </p><p class="no-margin">The designer role applies across all platforms (parent and partner platforms) and all types (including public training or ‚Äúanonymous‚Äù training).</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">You can configure the role of designer by choosing whether he can access all the training courses on the platform or only those for which he is the designer.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">For more information, see the article <a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/4550442">Settings - Roles</a>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="facilitator-" data-post-processed="true">Facilitator<b> </b></h2><p class="no-margin">The facilitator is the person who facilitates training in a classroom or virtual class.</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>A facilitator from outside the company (facilitator role):</b></p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">This is generally a user from outside to the company. For this reason, a facilitator role has been created; a person with this role cannot take a training course on the platform.</p><p class="no-margin">However, if the person has been appointed to facilitate blended training for the classroom (or virtual class) section, this person will be able to view the previous e-learning module forming part of the same training. A facilitator has access to the statistics for training where he or she facilitates a classroom module, etc. (including e-learning modules).</p><p class="no-margin"><b><i> </i></b></p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>A facilitator from within the company (facilitator attribute):</b></p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">It is possible to appoint a person within the company to facilitate a classroom session. In this case, you only need to designate any platform user as the session facilitator (this person will a role other than facilitator, most often simply a learner). </p><p class="no-margin">In this case, the person will have the same privileges as an external facilitator (facilitator role) over the sessions to be facilitated. In addition, this person will obviously have the permissions and access specific to their role (in general those of learner, but possibly any other role).</p><p class="no-margin"><b> </b></p><p class="no-margin"><b> </b></p><h2 id="community-manager-" data-post-processed="true">Community manager<b> </b></h2><p class="no-margin">The Community Manager‚Äôs role is limited to facilitating (moderating forums and creating discussion topics) forums and the news feed.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="group-manager-" data-post-processed="true">Group manager<b> </b></h2><p class="no-margin">When a user is created, one or more managers of this group can be created (they are then necessarily part of the group created).</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Being a group manager entitles you to 2 basic functions:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">Group manager(s) have <b>access to the statistics</b> for their group, considering all training combined.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Group manager(s) have permissions to <b>approve registration requests</b> (from the catalog) for training for their group members.</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">Furthermore, a group manager <b>may be authorized to register group members directly for training</b>. The administrator (partner administrator, as applicable) can really specify a restricted list of training courses for which a group manager can directly register their group members without there being a registration request from the learner group member (for details, refer to the ‚ÄúManaging Groups‚Äù module/stage).</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">You can configure the role of Group Manager by choosing whether he can create and modify users on the platform.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">For more information, see the article <a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/4550442">Settings - Roles</a>.</p><p class="no-margin"><b> </b></p><h2 id="learner-" data-post-processed="true">Learner </h2><p class="no-margin">He/she learns and only has access to the statistics relating to him/her. </p><p class="no-margin">A learner is necessarily associated with only one Platform.</p><p class="no-margin">Either he/she is an ‚ÄúInternal‚Äù Learner if he/she has access to the Parent or Internal Platform;</p><p class="no-margin">Or he/she is a ‚ÄúPartner‚Äù Learner if he/she has access to one of the Partner Platforms.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"><i>Last updated on 10/19/2020</i></p><p class="no-margin"></p></article>
    </div>
  </div>

    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Different types of users</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 07/13/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4004378/square_128/photo_profil-1587972480.png?1587972480" alt="Claire Philippe avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Claire Philippe</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">For administrators and learners, the <b>Type</b> must also be specified:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">Internal or partner <b>for administrators</b></p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Internal, partner or public <b>for learners</b><br> </p></li></ul><h2 id="administrators-partner-administrators" data-post-processed="true">Administrators Partner Administrators</h2><p class="no-margin"><b>Internal administrators </b>have the highest level of permissions, both on the main platform but also on all potential partner platforms.</p><p class="no-margin">When we talk below about an administrator without any particular specification, this will mean an internal type administrator.</p><p class="no-margin">A <b>partner administrator *</b> must be associated to a given unique partner platform that must be specified. A partner administrator, unlike an administrator, can only work on the scope of their partner platform.</p><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="learners-partner-learners-and-public-learners" data-post-processed="true">Learners, Partner Learners and Public Learners</h2><p class="no-margin"><b>Internal learners</b> are the main platform‚Äôs core learners. They only have access to the specified training for the main platform, excluding training created for partner platforms. For the sake of simplicity, or special mention, we will talk about learners to mean internal learners.<br></p><p class="no-margin"><b>Partner learners *</b> are core learners of the partner platform with which they are associated. They only have access to training specified for this particular partner platform.<br></p><p class="no-margin"><b>Public learners</b> are learners of any other type, in that they don‚Äôt have access to conventional training intended for internal learners or partner learners.</p><p class="no-margin">These are external people who don‚Äôt initially have user accounts but who can be offered public training courses (i.e. part of a separately administered training catalog, called the public catalog).</p><p class="no-margin">Such public training is generally paid for and compiled in a specific public catalog that can be viewed without having a user account on the platform. After viewing the public catalog, the external person can ask to be registered for public training and, after having been registered and having paid the price for the public training course, a public user account will be created to allow this person to take the public training purchased. Public learners only have access to public training courses contained in the public catalog.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">‚ÑπÔ∏è<b><i> </i></b>It is only possible to create partner administrators or partner learners if partner platforms have previously been created.</p></article>

  <div class="paper paper__large">

    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Training tree structure on Rise Up</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 07/24/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4004378/square_128/photo_profil-1587972480.png?1587972480" alt="Claire Philippe avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Claire Philippe</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">In summary:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Training</b> is the central element of the Rise Up model.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">All training comprises different <b>modules (e-learning</b> or <b>classroom</b>).</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">An <b>e-learning module</b> is made up of <b>stages</b></p></li><li><p class="no-margin">A <b>classroom module</b> is made up of classroom <b>sessions</b></p></li><li><p class="no-margin">It is possible to combine several training courses in a <b>training path</b>.</p></li></ul><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/230186541/b9b9f09f92f8e00dd7b49ea7/image.png?expires=1620407104&amp;signature=ba587d94df83f3501262b759d46ee2400a015c034fefd61ca06d68b7402563a8" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/230186541/b9b9f09f92f8e00dd7b49ea7/image.png?expires=1620407104&amp;signature=ba587d94df83f3501262b759d46ee2400a015c034fefd61ca06d68b7402563a8"></a></div><h2 id="training-path" data-post-processed="true">Training path</h2><p class="no-margin">A <b>training path</b> therefore represents the highest level of the architecture. </p><p class="no-margin">A training path is a series (/a set) of several training courses that complement each other, the aim of which is to achieve a common learning objective.</p><p class="no-margin">To create a training path, you must have previously created all the training courses to be linked to it in the platform. </p><p class="no-margin">It is not essential to create and attach a ‚Äútraining path‚Äù to a training. Some training, which is the most conventional situation, comprises an individual training course, not included in a ‚Äútraining path‚Äù.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Below the training path is the training level.<br></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="training-" data-post-processed="true">Training </h2><p class="no-margin">The aim of <b>training</b> is to acquire skills and knowledge. It consists of one or more <b>modules</b>.<br><br></p><h2 id="module" data-post-processed="true">Module</h2><p class="no-margin"><b>A module</b> corresponds to a means of learning. There are actually two different kinds of module:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">E-learning</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Classroom (the definition of classroom also includes virtual classes)</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">Each module has its own structure, depending on whether it is an e-learning module or a classroom module.</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">An e-learning module is made up of<b> stages</b>.<b> </b>The stage corresponds to the content of the module, and forms the last level of an e-learning module. This content can vary in nature (video, documents, quizzes, surveys, etc.).<br>Learners have to go through all the stages of an e-learning module to complete it.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">A classroom module is made up of <b>sessions</b>. A session is defined by the date and place of the training session.<br>Unlike the stages making up an e-learning module, all of which must be completed by the learner to complete the e-learning module, only one of the various classroom sessions offered in the module must be attended to complete the classroom module.</p></li></ul></article>

  <div class="paper paper__large">
  <div class="content content__narrow">
    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Training Management</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 08/14/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4405384/square_128/DSC09723_%281%29-1603897479.jpg?1603897479" alt="Kevin Legros avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Kevin Legros</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">Below is the Training Management Menu (access via <b>Side Menu</b> &gt; <b>Training</b>)</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/236433613/aa05e8cd9f05448d08ee286b/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-14+%C3%A0+16.42.08.png?expires=1620407306&amp;signature=aba3dc2125b448fa8702515a6b8ce1daf184fb1aed0771f610daa5f80c8d58d3" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/236433613/aa05e8cd9f05448d08ee286b/Capture+d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran+2020-08-14+%C3%A0+16.42.08.png?expires=1620407306&amp;signature=aba3dc2125b448fa8702515a6b8ce1daf184fb1aed0771f610daa5f80c8d58d3"></a></div><p class="no-margin"><b>View</b>: Allows you to display the list of all training courses, regardless of their state (draft, awaiting validation, published). A sorting feature with several criteria makes it possible to quickly find the training sought, to modify it, delete it or duplicate it (it allows you to create a new training more quickly). This is where you can access a course in 'draft' state to continue working on it (that is say, edit it) and finalize it for publication. For more information see<a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3975348"> Manage trainings created</a>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"><b>Create</b>: Allows you to create a new training course, whether it is an e-learning course, classroom training or "blended learning" training.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"><b>Validate trainings</b>: Allows direct access to trainings that have been created by "Designers" to validate them and therefore publish them. In the most common configuration, designers can actually create training courses, but the publication of training courses requires the approval of an Administrator. </p><p class="no-margin">For more information see <a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3975342">Manage trainings created by Designers</a>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"><b>Pending corrections</b>: Allows direct access to exams and quizzes taken by learners to correct them.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"><b>Manage classroom sessions</b>: Allows you to create classroom sessions, modify them, cancel them, validate them and also manage user registrations for the various classroom sessions.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"><b>Manage categories</b>: Allows you to create training categories and subcategories and view them. When you create a course, you can attach it to one or more categories (assuming that these categories have been created beforehand). This makes it possible to help search for training in the same category, to carry out reports specific to one or more categories or to define objectives for users that are linked to a training category (e.g. spending x hours of training during the month of June on all training in the category 'mastery of safety rules').</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">‚ö†Ô∏è Only Administrators of the main Platform can create Training Categories. Partner Administrators do not have access to this section.</p></article>
    </div>

  <div class="paper paper__large">
  <div class="content content__narrow">
    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Create a training</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 07/30/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4004378/square_128/photo_profil-1587972480.png?1587972480" alt="Claire Philippe avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Claire Philippe</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">To access the <b>training creation section</b>, follow <b>Side Menu </b>&gt; <b>Training </b>&gt; <b>Create</b>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Only admins, partner admins, and designers can create a course.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/231852223/59e4f9255d73b7eabeef43d1/image.png?expires=1619958522&amp;signature=4e03fec358267910849d44229d6b2a9b70a199707adacc5218fc97d562167dba" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/231852223/59e4f9255d73b7eabeef43d1/image.png?expires=1619958522&amp;signature=4e03fec358267910849d44229d6b2a9b70a199707adacc5218fc97d562167dba"></a></div><p class="no-margin"><b>To create training, you need to:</b></p><ul><li><p class="no-margin">Stage 1 - Complete the training description and configuration information -&gt; Training Description Sheet</p></li><li><p class="no-margin">Stage 2 - Create the Training content</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">You will need to complete the sections below which you will find detailed in the dedicated articles:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974260">General information</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="http://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974262">Detailed information (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974276">Configuration (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974277">Information about the organization (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974282">Customized fields (optional)</a></p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">Once all these sections are filled in, click the button <b>Next</b> to save the data entered and move on to Stage 2.</p><p class="no-margin">Once you have clicked the <b>Next</b> button, your Training will be saved in <b>Draft</b> status and you will be able to find it again to edit it or continue working on it from the View Training page (<b>Side Menu &gt; Training &gt; View</b>)</p></article>

  <div class="paper paper__large">
  <div class="content content__narrow">
    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Create a training &gt; General information</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 07/30/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4004378/square_128/photo_profil-1587972480.png?1587972480" alt="Claire Philippe avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Claire Philippe</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">When creating a training course, the following information must be completed:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974260">General information</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="http://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974262">Detailed information (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974276">Configuration (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974277">Information about the organization (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974282">Customized fields (optional)</a></p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">This article focuses on the <b>General information</b> section.<br><br></p><h2 id="title" data-post-processed="true">Title</h2><p class="no-margin">The title of the training is a required field, which will be included in legal documents, but also in e-mails.<br><br> </p><h2 id="language" data-post-processed="true">Language</h2><p class="no-margin">The default language is French. It is possible to choose another language from more than 20 languages available.<br><br></p><h2 id="teaching-time-" data-post-processed="true">Teaching time </h2><p class="no-margin">Teaching time is the ‚Äúestimated‚Äù time to complete the training. This field is required and must be completed immediately, but it can be edited later if it turns out that your estimate of the teaching time was wrong.</p><p class="no-margin"><br> </p><h2 id="type" data-post-processed="true">Type</h2><p class="no-margin">Several choices are offered (depending on the pre-configuration):</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Multi-scope</b>: this is the choice to be made if you want to create training for users who already have a user account on the Internal Platform and/or on one or more Partner Platforms.</p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Public</b>: this choice is only offered if you have activated the Public Catalog in the Configuration.</p></li></ul><p class="no-margin"><i>What is Public Training?</i></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Public Training is training intended to be offered to an External Learner, meaning that the learner does not have a user account on the Platform. This can be, and often is, paid training.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"><i>Principle of access to public training</i>:</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Once the public training has been created, an access URL can be retrieved and made available to the ‚Äúaudience‚Äù deemed to be interested. The potential learner will then be able to access the Platform to view the Public Training (access to the public training description sheet without needing a User account). If the external Learner decides to take the Public Training offered, he/she then has to register on the Platform and a User account must be created.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><b>Anonymous</b>: it is the only type of training that someone can take without having a user account on the Platform (hence the term ‚Äúanonymous‚Äù). Thus, there is no count of the number of licenses for an ‚Äúanonymous user‚Äù.<br>‚ö†Ô∏è The term can be confusing, because ‚Äúanonymous‚Äù training enables the first &amp; last names and e-mail address of the ‚Äúlearner‚Äù to be retrieved and even be included in reports on such training. However, </p></li></ul><p class="no-margin"><i>Principle of access to Anonymous Training:</i></p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">When creating ‚Äúanonymous‚Äù training, a URL link will be generated and can be shared by the administrator with the external user. The user will have to fill in their first &amp; last names and e-mail address, and will then be able to take the training immediately. In general, this feature is used to send questionnaires and quizzes to people outside the company. Typical example: as part of a recruitment process, it is possible to ask everyone who has applied and sent their CVs to complete a quiz, questionnaire or test, to perform an initial screen of the applicants.</p><p class="no-margin">‚ÄúAnonymous‚Äù training is ‚Äúephemeral‚Äù for anyone who takes it. In fact, if someone returns to the access URL sent for their training after a certain period, the training will no longer be accessible and so, for a quiz or questionnaire, it will not be possible to add to the answers.</p><p class="no-margin">From the company‚Äôs viewpoint, ‚ÄúAnonymous‚Äù training does not appear in the Training Catalog (nor in the ‚ÄúPublic‚Äù Catalog). Administrators will be able to access it through the View Training Page ( <b>Side Panel &gt; Training &gt; View</b>).</p><p class="no-margin">The company will be able to view the results of Anonymous training in the same way as other training (‚Äúmulti-scope‚Äù or ‚Äúpublic‚Äù training courses).</p><p class="no-margin">‚ö†Ô∏èOnce the type of the training created (Multi-scope, Public, Anonymous) has been approved, it can no longer be changed. You will need to duplicate the training to be able to change the Training Type.</p><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="scopes" data-post-processed="true">Scopes</h2><p class="no-margin">Only completed for ‚Äúmulti-scope‚Äù training. In this case, it is necessary to specify the Scope over which the training being created will be available, i.e. list all Platforms (internal platform and/or one or more partner platforms) on which the training being created will be published.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/231859325/df63df1e6060bc79b173b384/image.png?expires=1619961538&amp;signature=02886af53f104a67c28613079b082565f14a3444f22f8259db23773fb42587bf" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/231859325/df63df1e6060bc79b173b384/image.png?expires=1619961538&amp;signature=02886af53f104a67c28613079b082565f14a3444f22f8259db23773fb42587bf"></a></div><p class="no-margin">‚ö†Ô∏è Partner administrators have no choice of types and scopes. They can only publish their training on their partner platform</p><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="designers" data-post-processed="true">Designers</h2><p class="no-margin">By default, the designer‚Äôs name displayed is the name of the person who creates the training. It is also possible to change the designer or add one or more other designers. The same training can have several designers. Note that, as with administrators, there is no hierarchy among designers, which means that all designers designated for a given training course have the authority to edit it simultaneously. This requires a minimum degree of coordination between the different designers of the same training.  </p><p class="no-margin"><br> </p><h2 id="image" data-post-processed="true">Image</h2><p class="no-margin">The ideal image size is 500 x 500 pixels</p><p class="no-margin"><br> </p><h2 id="banner" data-post-processed="true">Banner</h2><p class="no-margin">The ideal size is 2000 x 500 pixels.</p><p class="no-margin">Default images are offered in the platform, but it is also possible to search for images on the Internet, or to import images from your computer. The image and banner are required fields when creating training, to ensure a consistent visual appearance for users when they access the catalog(s) and/or the list of training courses for which they are registered.</p></article>

  <div class="paper paper__large">
  <div class="content content__narrow">
    <div class="article intercom-force-break">
      <div class="article__meta" dir="ltr">
          <h1 class="t__h1">Creating a training &gt; Detailed information</h1>
          <div class="article__desc">
            Last updated on 07/30/2020
          </div>
          <div class="avatar">
  <div class="avatar__photo o__ltr">
      <img src="https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/4004378/square_128/photo_profil-1587972480.png?1587972480" alt="Claire Philippe avatar" class="avatar__image">

  </div>
  <div class="avatar__info">
    <div>
      Written by <span class="c__darker"> Claire Philippe</span>
        <br> Updated over a week ago
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

      </div>
      <article dir="ltr"><p class="no-margin">When creating a training course, the following information must be completed:</p><ul><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974260">General information</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="http://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974262">Detailed information (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974276">Configuration (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974277">Information about the organization (optional)</a></p></li><li><p class="no-margin"><a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3974282">Customized fields (optional)</a></p></li></ul><p class="no-margin">This article focuses on the "<b>Detailed Information"</b> section.<br>Please note that completing this information is optional.</p><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="categories" data-post-processed="true">Categories</h2><p class="no-margin">A <b>category</b> corresponds to a training subject area.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">The training category must have been created before completing the description sheet. If not, this field cannot be completed. You can create as many categories and sub-categories as you wish.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">The category lets you filter training by subject area, and compile reports using this category.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">The category can only be created by the administrator. This is not a required field.</p><p class="no-margin">If training is created by an Administrator, direct access to the category creation page will be possible here by clicking:</p><p class="no-margin"></p><div class="intercom-container"><a href="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/231860547/099644c6d850ac2ea20978b0/image.png?expires=1620407307&amp;signature=478ef9effd8ac7dcbde3571ba5304a8d9cd60c3956aa78205cacf115996b7f14" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img src="https://downloads.intercomcdn.com/i/o/231860547/099644c6d850ac2ea20978b0/image.png?expires=1620407307&amp;signature=478ef9effd8ac7dcbde3571ba5304a8d9cd60c3956aa78205cacf115996b7f14"></a></div><p class="no-margin">‚ÑπÔ∏è Partner Administrators do not have the ability to create or modify a category. Only the Principal / Internal Administrator has the possibility.<br></p><h2 id="keywords" data-post-processed="true">Keywords</h2><p class="no-margin">Keyword is a term used to search the training catalog for particular training more quickly and easily. The keyword can be created immediately when completing the description sheet.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">These keywords can be created by the designer and administrator. This is not a required field.</p><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="prerequisites" data-post-processed="true">Prerequisites</h2><p class="no-margin">Prerequisites are conditions to be met, a skill required to take the training.</p><p class="no-margin">As applicable, you can select one or more existing training courses as ‚Äúprerequisites‚Äù for the training you are creating. </p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">Thus, the ‚Äúlearner‚Äù will have had to take the training listed as ‚Äúpre-requisites‚Äù before being able to take the training you are creating.<br><br> </p><h2 id="video-" data-post-processed="true">Video </h2><p class="no-margin">A descriptive video can be added to the training description sheet in order to explain and communicate about the training. This can be imported from your computer (<b>upload</b>), but it is also possible to insert the <b>URL link</b> for the video (add the URL and click on the <b>Add</b> button. </p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">This video or link will appear below the training description in the catalog. It cannot be larger than 5 gigabytes. </p><p class="no-margin"><br></p><h2 id="description" data-post-processed="true">Description</h2><p class="no-margin">This description can be entered in text format. But it is also possible to include an image and/or a video. A PDF file can also be included and a link will be generated automatically in the insert. Just click it to access the content.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="objective" data-post-processed="true">Objective</h2><p class="no-margin">Used to describe the teaching objectives of the training. These can only be entered as text and can be formatted.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="message-for-the-registration-e-mail" data-post-processed="true">Message for the registration e-mail</h2><p class="no-margin">The registration e-mail allows you to customize learners‚Äô registration for training and to give additional details about the training. This message will be automatically integrated into emails containing the <b>{registrationmailmessage} </b>field. It is included by default in the email notifying the learner of his registration for a training course (template email # 62)</p><p class="no-margin">For more information see : <a href="https://help.riseup.ai/fr/articles/3970582">Manage email templates</a>.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin"></p><h2 id="external-link" data-post-processed="true">External link</h2><p class="no-margin">This link is used to provide additional information about the training. It can be a link to a company site, an intranet site, or a press article related to training.</p><p class="no-margin"></p><p class="no-margin">This link will appear in the training description sheet accessible from the Catalog.</p></article>
    </div>
  </div>
